Renauld, seeing no other choice to protect the people, decided to comply. As evening approached, he walked north along the road to the Castle Ravenloft. The bridge stood open when he arrived, and the doors to the keep the same. Once inside, he was greeted by Raphail, who led him to the banquet hall, where Strahd waited. Renauld refused to eat or drink any of the food or wine that Strahd offered him, and he and Strahd conversed for some time. Strahd made him an offer, that if he and his companions could solve the werewolf problem, by whatever means, he would allow the village to continue living in peace. Renauld responded that he would accept the offer, but warned Strahd that he might well be back to destroy Strahd himself. Strahd shrugged, seeming unconcerned, and told Renauld that he might find that Strahd was a better lord than many of the mortal variety. They debated the merits back and forth, until eventually after some time had passed, Strahd said they he had others matters of his domain to attend to, and had a half-celestial escort Renauld out. Renauld spoke with the half-celestial about Strahd as they walked, and was somewhat concerned by the attitude of the half-celestial towards Strahd. However, he returned to the village. When he returned, the rest of the party intensely inspected him for magical compulsion or perhaps him being an undead in disguise. Finding none of these things, they asked him what had happened and he relayed his story, saying that Strahd was the “worst kind of evil, the kind that hides behind the thin veneer of nobility.” They then began discussing what to do next. They buried Ashlyn in the south cemetery of town, and then decided to go to the Vistani and to obtain the platinum hilt they would need to re-empower the Sunsword. Renauld decided to stay in town with Ulrick and defend the village against further incursion or assault.

On Xen’drik, Kit’arhia and Aleko arrived back at Kit’arhia’s tribal encampment. They spoke with the Eldest, the druid leader of her tribe. After relating the tale, the Eldest decided to have Kit’arhia escort Aleko the three hundred miles to Stormreach. After gathering some basic supplies (both Aleko and Kit’arhia have rings of sustenance which allow them to travel without food or water), they set out north across the savannah towards the jungle.

When they arrived at the Vistani encampment, Alexander went to speak to Madame Eva. He told her of his need for a platinum hilt to reforge the sword, and that he did not have the money to pay for it. She offered a favor for a favor. If they could find out the source of and put a stop to the disappearance of some of her Vistani up north by Tser falls. Around this time, Lassius arrived in the town of Barovia and began asking questions of what townspeople he could find. Other than Renauld, he found few willing to talk to him, with recent events making the villagers extremely suspicious of outsiders other than the party. At Tser Falls, the party encountered a pack of wolves and numerous traps. As the wolves fell back under their assault, they followed them into an unlit cave behind the falls. From the cliffs above, a pack of ghouls and ghasts observed the party from the cover of the mists. Inside, Varkov the trapper waited and ambushed them, firing his crossbow from the cover of darkness. Lars summoned forth a lantern archon and battle was joined. In the end, it was Alexander, charging over the area of a grease spell, sliding down a hill, and running Varkov through as he fell that won the day. The remaining wolves and worgs went berserk and were slain by the party. They explored the rest of the cave, finding several stuffed humans, a stuffed bear, and a fake stuffed werewolf in hybrid form.

Lassius, finding little in the way of answers in town, headed north to the Vistani encampment. The party arrived back at the camp around the same time as he arrived there. While Alexander went to report to Madame Eva, and receive the platinum hilt for the Sunsword, the rest of the party talked with Lassius, who asked them numerous questions about the region, finding them much more informative. Once he had gotten the answers to his questions, he tried to use a sending coin to report back to his ‘home office’ in Karnath, but found the magical communication out of the valley blocked. This was puzzling to him, so he accompanied the party back to the village of Barovia. The party spotted the ghouls as they traveled and were about to attack them, when the ghouls reminded the party of their pack with Strahd. At the edge of the village, the ghouls disappear into the mists. Ashlyn’s body, infused with negative energy from Raphail’s attack digs it’s way up out of the ground in which it is buried.

6 Vulk, midnight: Alexander, Lars, and Lorsanna meet with Renauld to report on their success in the Blood on the Vine inn in the middle of town. Renauld gets Ismark to tell Lassius about the events leading up to their arrival, and the party discovers Strahd’s obsession with his sister, Illyena. On the edge of town, the first living person the newly risen Ashlyn encounters is Demisi, who easily seizes control of the newly risen spawn. Somewhat irritated by the disruption, Demisi heads towards the Blood on the Vine to taunt the party about their companion’s state.

6 Vulk, day: Lassius spent the morning trying to interview Demisi, which did not go terribly well, but nor did it get him attacked. Then the party set out towards the woods to hunt the remaining werewolves. Soon after they departed, rain began to pour from the sky. Alexander stayed behind with Renault in town, guarding the town. The party encountered a werewolf ambush, but slaughtered the attacking wolves. Continuing through the woods, the werewolves and their corrupted nymph leader were waiting for the party at the cave that served as their home. After a fierce battle, the werewolf pack was slaughtered and their nymph leader slain. Strahd witnessed this through his scyring spell. In a fit of rage at having his plans ruined, he headed towards the village of Barovia, with Kavan, Rafail, and Sasha in tow. The entire village became choked with mist as the vampires approached. Alexander and Renauld were sitting in the tavern when they heard a crash and stone shattering outside. Alexander ran outside to investigate, wandering through the mist till he found a wooden stake sticking up through the stone. Suddenly screams began to resound throughout the mist as vampires began pulling people from their homes and killing them, targeting anyone who had helped the party. Rafail manifested ontop of Alexander’s horse and the two fought. Rafail had difficulty passing Alexander’s imbued shield, but nor could Alexander injure Rafail. However, with one of the major targets located, Sasha closed in on him, bombarding him with magic against which Alexander had no defense. Renauld used his magic to keep them at bay for a moment and yelled for Alexander to flee. Rafail turned his attention to the priest and bore him to the ground. Alexander stayed a moment longer, but as Kavan emerged from the mist, he realized he stood no chance at all against their combined might and retreated towards the Vistani camp. Demisi fled into the woods, having the vampiric Ashlyn and her skeletal butler, Alfred cover her as she fell back to what she felt was a safer location.

The party returned to town an hour later, covered in water and victory, to find the town dead quiet. They rode to the center of town and found the bodies of the townsfolk. The rest of the day was spent digging graves and investigating. The twenty or so survivors of the town refused to emerge or speak with them. Around nightfall Alexander returned from the camp, and told the rest of the party what had happened. After re-fortifying the Blood on the Vine, they bunkered down for the night.

7 Vulk: The party gathered their strength and marched off towards Castle Ravenloft. As they approached the drawbridge the rain slowed to a slight drizzle, and they noticed green slime dripping from the archway behind the portcullis. By using Lars conjured mount as a shield they were able to pass under it unharmed. Entering the castle, they passed two stone dragons which suddenly sprang to life, spraying the party with fire. Their battle carried them into the next room where gargoyles swept from the alcoves of the room to strafe the party. The party slew the two stone dragons and, when the gargoyles proved unable to effectively damage the party, they retreated. The party spread out, exploring the entrance hall, and coming across a door leading to a banquet hall. Inside was Strahd, who turned and greeted them with expectation. He explained what his plan regarding the werewolves had been, and how they had played their part of an outside threat a little too well, annihilating the allies that Strahd had intended to drive to his doorstep. For ruining his plans, he promised the party a painful death. During the course of the conversation, he managed to seize control of Lassius’s mind with his dominate ability. However, he did not make use of this immediately. At the end of the conversation, he converted to mist form and flowed up through the ceiling, but then merely made his way over to the chapel, expecting they would soon arrive. Once the party located the chapel, they began attempting to setup a defense perimeter. However, once Strahd’s assault began the perimeter only trapped them in as they fought desperately for their lives. They drove off Strahd once, but a few hours later, he returned at full strength and began assaulting them with magic, using his link to Lassius to locate the party. As the party’s spells ran low, Alexander made a desperate strike, charging his horse up the balcony and leaping into the air to strike a blow against Strahd to force him back to his coffin. During the battle, Strahd err’d and ordered Lassius to use his dispel magic without excluding himself from the area, allowing him to break the dominate. They then withdraw back to the cave where they had fought Varkov the Trapper to rest and regain their strength.

8 Vulk: As the party rested in the cave, they came under attack from Rafail and four vampire spawn. However, they easily drove them off. The party then decided to try a different approach to entering the castle, going up the sides of the walls with spider climb magic. After selecting a tower for ascent, they reached the top and discovered a strange and twisted garden, and its gardener, the barbed devil, Khyristirix. After an intense battle in which both Alexander and Lorsanna were nearly slain, they slew Khyristirix and two of her three warlock servants. The most powerful of the three, Trina, escaped however, via flee the scene. The party found the hellheart locket on Khyristirix’s body. The party was however grievously wounded, and withdrew to the deep northern forests of Barovia.

9 Vulk: The party returned to the castle, sneaking in via Lassius’s invisibility sphere spell. They began wandering the castle, exploring through various rooms in the first and second floor. Eventually they passed through the throne room and back down through the first floor and then up the staircase until the reached the Dayheart landing. Rafail and the vampire spawn assigned to guard it immediately engaged them. Strahd himself arrived a few rounds later to defend his artifact which a great deal of his power had been invested in. Lorsanna was able to turn Rafail and the other lesser vampires, forcing them to flee, but Strahd remained, tearing and slashing at them in his feral form. The battle raged all across the landing, but the party managed to drive Strahd back with seconds left before Rafail and the vampire spawn returned. The party retreated at full speed down the stairs. All the vampires left from the top of the landing down towards the party, reverting to mist at the bottom to avoid the impact, but Lorsanna released another pulse of positive energy, destroying the four spawn. Rafail endured the attack and pursued the party through the halls for a few moments more before Lorsanna’s third pulse pushed him back again. He yelled the command word for the drawbridge to shut, but Lars blasted the chains apart and causing the drawbridge to come crashing down. The party retreated down the mountain, followed in the air by Rafail in his bat form. However, once they reached the river, he had to turn south to follow the long way as he could not cross running water. The party retreated again into the forest.

Meanwhile, Demisi had returned to the village, and ordered Ashlyn to kill some of the villagers and turn them into vampire spawn under her (and therefore, Demisi’s) command. This, Demisi planned, would give her a reasonably strong expendable force. Further, as Strahd’s wards around Barovia were attuned to the living and not the dead, it allowed her to use the expendable spawn as messengers to her superiors in the Blood of Vol, and request reinforcements.

10 Vulk: Lars developed a plan of attack for assaulting the Dayheart. The party rode up to the entrance to the castle in the morning, and Lassius climbed up the side walls up to where the devil’s garden was via his spider climb while invisible. The rest of the party was teleported by Lars to the garden, and they crossed the catwalk to the Dayheart landing. Strahd and Rafail were there waiting for them, however, and the party was driven back almost immediately and forced to retreat by Lars’ teleport.

Strahd unleashed his own power, raining poisons, lightning, and fire, all charged with negative energy against the party. It offered him a Faustian pact, and he bargained for a time, but not wanting to be caught bargaining with a devil when the rest of the party returned, he asked to defer the bargaining until a later date. Moments later, the party returned via teleport once more.

12 Vulk: The party returned again to the castle to explore, this time descending down into the depths below the castle. However, a trap split Alexander and Ulrick from the rest of the party, as two giant ants and an invisible troll stalker attacked. However, Lorsanna simply lay the stalker to sleep with deep slumber. Alexander and Ulrick wandered about the upper floors where the trap had taken them, but eventually wandered down into a nest of demons. They barely survived the encounter, but realized they had certainly taken a wrong turn, and headed back upstairs to look for a different route. In the meantime, the rest of the group had made their way back up to the second floor of the castle. They entered a dining room, and opened a window, letting in the dim light of the overcast sky, and then proceeded to open the door to a study, in which stood Strahd. His presence ordained by the Fortunes of Ravenloft, he stood his ground, again throwing his magic against the party’s. Lars, Lorsanna, and Lassius had been growing stronger, however, but it still seemed a near even battle, until finally Alexander and Ulrick managed to surround him and finally he was forced into mist form. They spread out and searched through the study, and found numerous magical tomes and books of theory, some quite ancient and rare, and a copy of Strahd’s spellbook. Lassius found a secret passage in the fireplace, though Alexander set off a trap in his eagerness to open it. Inside was a chest, and another secret passage. Moving down this new passage, the party was engaged by two human sized spiders. They slew them and continued down the passage. At the end, concealed behind another secret passage was the true treasury, and the Tome of Strahd.

After summoning a celestial monkey to set off any traps on it, they retrieved the tome and withdrew from the castle. Lars began studying the tome.

Meanwhile, Demisi, realizing they have obtained the tome, sets out to find the party and make a deal to obtain it. She posts undead birds near numerous major landmarks with orders to alert her if they spot the party and sets up in town to wait.

13 Vulk: After revealing what he had learned in the Tome of Strahd to the party, Lars formulated their plan of assault on the three fanes. Initially they considered a feint operation, but discarded the plan when they realized that the person performing the feint would almost certainly be killed. The plan eventually decided upon was to go first to the Swamp fane, and have Lars perform the Ritual of Transference there. However, that night, as they rested, the sky turned black, and a vortex of black clouds engulfed Castle Ravenloft. The negative energy which had been building in the body of Ireena had reached critical mass and she arose as Strahd’s new vampire bride. He was over-joyed at the success, and set about reconstructing her personality to more closely match his own twisted version of Tatiyana’s. The negative energy left a physical manifestation of taint, which poured down the side of the cliffs and filled the basin at the bottom. The party watched, disturbed.

14 Vulk: The sky’s remained black all day, and the liquid evil in the basin continued to rise. The party spent all day observing this phenomenon.

A skeletal Pegasus, still capable of flight, and instructions detailing her priorities are the only response Demisi receives.

In Xen’drik, Aleko and Kit’arhia arrive in Stormreach mostly intact, and begin trading some of the items they found for cash and seeking a place to stay. Kit’arhia has the gem she found in the Temple of the Claw made into a piece of jewelry, and smashes a rather rude gnome through the side of his own stall.

15 Vulk: The skies returned to their normal gray color, and the party sets out for the swamp. Once they arrive at the Swamp Fane, Lassius erects an illusion to conceal them, and Lars begins the Ritual of Transference. As he did so, the entire swamp seemed to come alive, with a sort of revitalizing force, as the links between Strahd and the land began to break. Demisi’s undead scouts observed this, and reported back to her. She gathered a few vampire spawn together, and placed a disguise undead spell on Alfred, making him appear to be a normal human skeleton instead of a boneclaw. She then approached the fane, and called out to the party. Alexander emerged from the cover of the illusion to negotiate with her, then returned under the cover of it to discuss with the rest of the party. Eventually, he and Ulrick agreed they could not cooperate with evil, and the two Paladins charged out of the illusion at Demisi. Alfred burst into his true form, nearly impaling Alexander as Ashlyn moved to block Ulrick. The Knight of the Raven and the former Lightbringer’s swords twirled back in forth in an eerie mirror of eachother, as Alexander attempted to get past Alfred to reach Demisi. Lassius dropped the magical illusion and began dispelling her magical defenses, while Lorsanna reduced the spawn she had brought with her to dust with a single pulse of positive energy. Once it became apparent that he couldn’t get past the boneclaw on his own, Alexander summoned his horse, Ersefail and charged past towards Demisi, who was under a harassing barrage of spells from Lassius. Alfred managed to trip Ersefail, but Alexander landed on his feet and kept charging. Ulrick put Ashlyn to rest and then turned on Alfred. Under this combined assault, Demisi’s undead minions were destroyed. Alexander demanded her surrender, which she promptly gave. They escorted her back to the fane, and searched her, going through her possessions. They grilled her about her motives and intentions, and she told them a second time how she sought the Tome of Strahd. In an odd reversal, in the end the party essentially offered her the same deal that she had initially offered them. The Tome of Strahd in exchange for her help. Demisi, though thoroughly annoyed at the destruction of two very useful minions, agreed.

16 Vulk: The party is able to reach and destroy Strahd after a confrontation with several of his vampire minions and traps, and finally Strahd himself. Light and sun returns to Bolvaria. With several people severely weakened, they returned to the town to heal. Alexander allowed Demisi to depart in accordance with the bargain they had made earlier, despite Lassius's unvoiced plan to use her as a patsy. However, unconscious as a result of the battle with Strahd, he was unable to interfere.

17 Vulk: With Lorsanna's healing magic recovered, she restores Lassius to consciousness. When he finds out about Demisi's departure, he is severely irritated, and with the mists now longer blocking egress from Bolvaria, he departs for the nearest House Sivis message station in order to report to his contacts.

19 Vulk: A squad of Karnath special forces teleports in on the party while they are relaxing at the Blood on the Vine tavern, accompanied by Lassius. They order the party to come with them immediately on pain of death. Lassius assures them it will be alright, and after the party consents, they are teleported into the presence of King Kaius III. For political reasons, the true story of what exactly had transpired in Castle Ravenloft would not be released, but a slightly alternative tale which kept them as the heroes would be supported by the Karnathi government, on the condition of their silence. The heroes agreed, in relatively short order, and were given several gifts as rewards for their services to the crown.

Yesterday was quite a day.  We had class and then barely anytime to eat lunch with our buddies before we had to rush off to go to see the Tokyo-Edo museum and some sumo.  We went from Shibuya to Yoyogi to Ryogoku to get there.  

Once we got to the actual history museum itself, it was pretty impressive.  You go up this series of escalators and come out at the top of the museum and there's a replica kabuki playhouse and other buildings right there on either side of an old style Japanese bridge.  There's all kinds of historical Japanese stuff there, from palanquins to scrolls to those folding out screens.  There's also all the old electronic devices, from Toshiba and the like, as well as bicycles and phone booths and stuff.  There were a lot of kids there on field trip, and one of the braver ones came up to me and tried out his English to greet me.  It was pretty bad, but he was a 6th-grade equivalent, so it's better than the Japanese I spoke at his age (that is, none).  As I started talking with him, all his friends came over, and then eventually their whole class, and they took pictures with me.  I'll have that one uploaded eventually.  Then I wandered around some more and was talking to Chyun (pronounced June) and a group of schoolgirls wanted to take a picture with me too.  Japanese schoolgirls are the most excitable beings in the universe.  Anything I or Chyun said or did excited them immensely.  After that I wandered around some more until me and Chyun sat down near these two obasan.  When the sixth graders passed by and I gave them my usual "Jya ne", the two obasan became very excited and started talking to us.  I was able to understand most of it, except a few times when I had to say something in English a couple different ways until they understood it.  Eventually, their husbands came back and they all took pictures with me again.  But then it was time to go.  So we went and saw sumo.  I'll admit, I wasn't too interested, as I am not interested in most sports.  So after the entrance ceremony for the senior division sumo, I left and headed back to the hotel.  Carly and Lindsey went with me, but they went with Chyun to go shopping in Harajuku when we ran into him later.  Well, I stopped and got some KFC on the way back.  It costs me about 1000 yen for what would cost me maybe US$8 in terms of how much chicken I got.  And it tastes really different. I got the crispy chicken, but it wasn't anything like the chicken at home.  The skin was tougher and chewier, even though it was the crunchy chicken.  Though the meat tasted pretty much the same.  So I ate them when I got back to the hotel and relaxed a bit, went by the computer lab at the school and talked to Ami for a bit.  But then she had to go rush off to her training again, and I went back to the hotel.  So then we went downstairs and some of the conversation buddies were going to Tokyo tower.  I think Elizabeth and Megan went with them.  Me, Jenni, Richard and Larry went back upstairs and tried to figure out something to do.  Carly, Lindsey, Ami and Emi showed up dressed for "going out", but we didn't go with them (at least not at this point), and the four of us wandered around Harajuku.  We passed the African Festa poster, and had a chuckle about it, and our on way back ran into Carly and co, with the new additions of Kazumi, her boyfriend Sato, Ayumi, Chyun, and Lisa.  I switched to this group, cause I wanted to hang out with the Japanese students and I figured I'd be back before too long.  So we went to this restraunt that has really famous hamburgers... but they were 2100 yen and I wasn't hungry, so I didn't eat.  We all had a good time at dinner, but Kazumi (+Sato), Ayumi and Lisa had to go eventually.  So then we went to this bar in Shibuya for a while.  I have to say, overall I think it was probably not worth the "entrance price" of a 300\ bowl of stuff nobody wanted to touch, especially since you had to also order other food.  But the drinks were pretty cheap, for Japan.  Well, we were there for a while, and Ami had to go, so that just left the 5 of us.  We had a fun time figuring out the bill split (I am honestly still not quite sure exactly how it was divided), and headed back.  Turns out we'd not been paying attention to the time and Emi had missed the last train.  

So we went back to the hotel and of course they wouldn't let her in, cause she wasn't on the registry, and guests can't come in after 11.  The guards I don't believe spoke English, so I was talking to them in Japanese, and they didn't realize that Emi was Japanese.  Probably cause I said "shoujotachi wa nihongo wo hanashimasen" and they thought I was including her in that.  But they would have just told her to go home if they'd realized.  Unfortunetly for her, home is like an hour away by train and that's a ton of cab money, especially at like 12:45.  Carly and Lindsey kept tellign her to try and beg, and I tried to explain that doesn't work in Japan.  So eventually, they went upstairs and I, not about to leave a woman to sleep in Mcdonalds alone as was her plan, went with her.  We found Chyun, who had been unable to get ahold of the friend he had been going to hang out with, and the three of us went to what is apparently the most famous Starbucks in Japan, and we sat there looking down on the square for a few hours until they closed, I think aroudn 3.   Heading for McDonalds, I discovered a LOT of Japanese people sleep at Mcdonalds.  I mean a lot.  When we got there, and actually until around 6:30, there were more people asleep there than awake.  So we sat there chatting.  Around 4, I feel asleep for an hour, but woke up at 5 and rejoined the conversation.  After 7:30 or so, we started walking around Shibuya and then took Ginza-sen to Omanote-Sando station, walked back to the hotel from there, and I promptly went upstairs and passed out

From this watching, they learned the British are very concerned about the following topics: A cricket player, who had gotten drunk the night before and capsized a peddle boat, and as a result was demoted from vice-captain of his crickett team. In hte morning, we received a surprisngly good breakfast considering the last nights burger fiasco, however, bacon apparently is ham. Also, no apple juice. I cannot even begin to describe hte pain I felt, when any character opened their mouth. Or moved. Or appeared anywhere on screen.

We checked out of the hotel, and went to Stonehenge. It was windy as well. Being cowards, we quickly fled to the gift shop after taking two pictures. It was REALLY windy.
